intro: Bennettia horsfieldii, commonly known as the Horsfield's bennettia, is a rare and unique plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt-laden air. It is considered endangered due to habitat loss and limited distribution. Bennettia horsfieldii plays an important ecological role in its native environment, supporting local pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
